Description: Fourteen gold beads from a necklace; eleven round examples hammered from sheet metal and soldered; three ribbed cylinders composed of plain gold wire spiralled into shape and soldered.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2018)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 81, Tomb 102 no. 3; pl. XIII, fig. 33)
